thread.title: Canadiens acquire Jordie Benn from Stars
thread.title_full: Canadiens acquire Jordie Benn from Stars

author: cbc
title: Canadiens acquire Jordie Benn from Stars
text:
The Montreal Canadiens traded for defenceman Jordie Benn from the Dallas Stars on Monday in exchange for defenceman Greg Pateryn and a fourth-round pick in this June's draft.
Benn, 29, has played 58 games with the Stars this season. The six-foot-two Victoria, B.C. native has two goals and 13 assists for 15 points with 24 penalty minutes. 
Benn is signed through the 2018-19 season with an annual average value of $1.1 million US, according to capfriendly.com.
Pateryn, 26, missed much of this season with a broken ankle. He has played 24 games with one goal and five assists.

"We want to thank Jordie for all his contributions both on the ice, and in the community," Stars GM Jim Nill said in a staterment. "We wish him all the best in his career going forward."
